alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 6:40AM CDT until June 16 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sumter County in west central Alabama... * Until 745 AM CDT. * At 640 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martin to near Stonewall to near Mill Creek to near Richton, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Epes, Emelle, Boyd, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Old Mallard Airport, Belmont, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Sumterville, Lilita, McDowell, Bellamy, I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba and Whitfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
